screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Settings" menu on a smartphone. It includes a search bar at the top, followed by options like adding another email account, managing network and internet settings (Wi-Fi, data usage, etc.), connected devices (Bluetooth), and apps & notifications settings. The bottom section displays the battery percentage (100%) and other status icons. The layout focuses on quick access to various phone settings.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.

think_action.Thought: The user wants to change the appearance of the keyboard. To do this, I should navigate to the language and input settings. From the current screen, this would typically be found under either the 'Apps & Notifications' or 'System' section of the settings. I will need to locate the 'Language & Input' or 'Keyboard' options to proceed with customizing the keyboard's appearance.
Future Action Plan: Scroll through the settings options to locate either 'Language & Input' or 'Keyboard' settings.
Once found, select the appropriate option to customize the keyboard's appearance.
think_action.Next Single Step Action: Scroll down to find 'Language & Input' or 'Keyboard' settings.
